Name: MakeMKV
Overview:
MakeMKV is your one-click solution to convert video that you own into free and
patents-unencumbered format that can be played everywhere. MakeMKV is a format
converter, otherwise called "transcoder". It converts the video clips from
proprietary (and usually encrypted) disc into a set of MKV files, preserving
most information but not changing it in any way. The MKV format can store
multiple video/audio tracks with all meta-information and preserve chapters.

The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client.
A fully automated mode is also available: insert a DVD or Blu-ray disc into an optical drive and let MakeMKV rips it without any user interaction.

Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less
than 150MB in download size).

For a complete documentation of this container, see
https://github.com/jlesage/docker-makemkv/blob/master/README.md

**NOTE**: For the container to have access to your optical drive(s), you need to
add them to your container configuration.  This is done by adding a new
*Device*.  An optical drive is represented by two Linux device files: */dev/srX*
and */dev/sgY*.  For optimal performance, the container needs both of them.  To
determine the right devices to use, start the container and look at its log.

@attributes.Name: Config Directory
@attributes.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

@attributes.Name: Storage
@attributes.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

@attributes.Name: Output Directory
@attributes.Description: This is the default output folder for converted videos.  Also used by the automatic disc ripper.<br>Container path: /output

@attributes.Name: User ID
@attributes.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

@attributes.Name: Group ID
@attributes.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

@attributes.Name: Umask
@attributes.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

@attributes.Name: Niceness (priority)
@attributes.Description: Priority at which the application should run.  A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions.  Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

@attributes.Name: Display Width
@attributes.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

@attributes.Name: Display Height
@attributes.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

@attributes.Name: Secure Connection
@attributes.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI.  Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated.  This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup.  Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes.  GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

@attributes.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
@attributes.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

@attributes.Name: Licence Key
@attributes.Description: MakeMKV registration key to use.  The key is written to the configuration file during container startup.  When set to <b><i>BETA</b></i>, the latest beta key is automatically used.  When set to <b><i>UNSET</b></i>, no key is automatically written to the configuration file.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Enabled
@attributes.Description: Set to 1 to enable automatic rippping of DVD/Blu-ray discs.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Custom MakeMKV Profile
@attributes.Description: Filename of the custom MakeMKV profile the automatic disc ripper should use.  The profile is expected to be found under the /config folder of the container, unless an absolute path is specified.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Eject
@attributes.Description: Set to 1 to eject disc when ripping is terminated.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Parallel
@attributes.Description: When set to 1, discs from all available optical drives are ripped in parallel.  Else, each disc from optical drives is ripped one at time.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Interval
@attributes.Description: Interval, in seconds, the automatic disc ripper checks for the presence of a DVD/Blu-ray discs.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Minimum Title Length
@attributes.Description: Titles with a length less than this value are ignored.  Length is in seconds.  By default, no value is set, meaning that value from MakeMKV's configuration file is taken.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Blu-ray Rip Mode
@attributes.Description: Rip mode of Blu-ray discs.  <b><i>mkv</b></i> is the default mode, where a set of MKV files are produced.  When set to <b><i>backup</b></i>, a copy of the (decrypted) file system is created instead. <b>NOTE</b>: This applies to Blu-ray discs only.  For DVD, MKV files are always produced.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Force Unique Output Directory
@attributes.Description: When set to <b><i>0</b></i>, files are written to <i>/output/DISC_LABEL/</i>, where <i>DISC_LABEL</i> is the label/name of the disc.  If this directory exists, then files are written to <i>/output/DISC_LABEL-XXXXXX</i>, where <i>XXXXXX</i> are random readable characters.  When set to <b><i>1</b></i>, the <i>/output/DISC_LABEL-XXXXXX</i> pattern is always used.

@attributes.Name: Automatic Disc Ripper: Disable Progress in GUI
@attributes.Description: When set to <b><i>1</b></i>, progress of discs ripped by the automatic disc ripper is not shown in the MakeMKV GUI.

@attributes.Name: WEB Port for GUI
@attributes.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>.  For other network types, port 5800 should be used instead.

@attributes.Name: VNC Port for GUI
@attributes.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol.  Optional if no VNC client is used.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>.  For other network types, port 5900 should be used instead.
